data.title: Show invisibles only when selecting text
data.body: I really hate to always see invisibles but they are useful sometimes… Some apps like Sublime Text only show invisibles when text is selected and it'd be great if there was such an option in Atom.

data.title: Atom asks to save changes when quitting (OS X)
data.body:
When quitting Atom, unsaved documents ask to save changes which is unexpected behaviour on OS X.

Other apps that are able to restore windows such as Pages, Numbers, Keynote and Sublime Text 3 don't ask to save changes, they simply open the unsaved documents the next time the app is launched.

data.title: Bad terminology with "Select next" and "Select all" items
data.body:
Both of these items are located in the Find menu but I don't find their names elucidative (I thought that **Select all** meant **Select all text**…). A easy way to avoid any ambiguity is to rename these items to **Select next match** and **Select all matches** or **Search next/all occurrences** for example.

I'd also argue these items should be inside the Selection menu and not in the Find menu given their names.

data.title: OS X's spelling checker
data.body: I'd prefer to use the built-in spelling checker from OS X. If possible, this could be a setting.

data.title: "else" autoindents backwards if the previous "if" is contained in one line
data.body: ![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15388116/11946525/81941d94-a853-11e5-8a35-d77ff432bb0f.gif)

data.title: XFCE TopMenu doesn't work with Atom
data.body: TopMenu is an XFCE extension that offers functionality equivalent to Ubuntu Unity and Mac OS X displaying the active application menu bar at the top (or any else actually, this is configurable) edge of the screen rather than at the top edge of the application window. All (all I have seen) modern applications built with up-to-date versions of the GTK+ toolkit seem to be compatible with it OOTB, some (like Mozilla Firefox) require extensions of their own to support this. Atom works just fine with the same functionality in Mac OS X (and, perhaps, in the original Ubuntu, but I had no opportunity to check) - this suggests that the modification required to introduce XFCE support is going to be rather humble. As far as I understand the technology [meant to be] behind this feature is what is called the dbusmenu protocol. I would be glad to try implementing it myself but I could not find the part of the code responsible for rendering the menu so far - please write a comment pointing to it perhaps.

data.title: Fix bug in grammar path scoring
data.body: This PR fixes a bug in grammar path scoring where a period would be treated the same as a path separator.  So instead, we only treat the _last_ period as the file extension separator.

data.title: [ Keyboard usability enhancement ] Dismiss find pane by hitting <Enter>
data.body:
Hi,

Whenever I look for any text after the search is done the only way to dismiss the search window is to hit Esc; a really good usability enhancement would be to automatically close the search pane and position the cursor at the first occurrence of the search, just like the search function works in Emacs or Vim.

Cheers.

data.title: Guess tabLength from file
data.body:
Hi!

It would be great if Atom can guest the tab length of the opened file to set the tabLength option.

Thanks!

data.title: Exceptions in .gitignore are not shown in file tree
data.body:
I'm working on a TypeScript project and having all the js files generated alongside the ts files during development. However certain libraries in the project are js files I have in a vendor folder. I have these two lines in my .gitignore so that the generated files don't clutter the repo or the tree view but still allow the vendor js files to be included in the repo:

```
*.js
!**/vendor/
```

This should exclude all js files but include any and all files in a vendor folder. According to SourceTree, my vendor/*.js files will be checked in however the file tree view in atom will not show anything under it.

![gitignore](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2836207/11938394/ce304e4c-a7d7-11e5-8875-c73ec9c6334a.PNG)

You can see that the arrow indicator next to vendor is pointed down so it should  be showing any files in that folder.

I've tried restarting atom and reordering my entries in .gitignore but so far I haven't found anything that works.

data.title: Atom freezes after opening a new pane and trying to open a file in it
data.body:
Hello,

I have just noticed that atom is freezing during the next steps:
1. Open atom
2. Open a new file by clicking it in the tree view
3. Split the view in two panes
4. Focus the new pane
5. Open a new file in the freshly created pane by clicking it in the tree view

Other info:
My atom version is: 1.3.2
I can also reproduce it when running atom with the --safe flag.
I don't get any crash report

data.title: Atom freeze when trying to open some files almost randomly
data.body:
### I have very strange problem

one of atom's processes using CPU for 100%
Developer tools - freezing as well, I'm not able to make profiling
AFAIK It is not depend on file content (I tried to comment out or even delete files content)
No logs output when run `atom --safe -l log.txt`
not depend on .atom settings folder - i tried to install it from scratch without plugins - still freezing 
### how to get crash logs?

windows 7, no admin rights, atom v1.3.1 and atom v1.3.2
project is using SVN

I know it looks like bullshit, but it depends on opened files, here are filenames:
`any other file`
`resources\trader\js\modules\dgOrder\directives\dgQuickOrderPopup\index.js`
`resources\trader\js\modules\dgOrder\controllers\dgQuickOrderPopup\index.js`

It is not depend on sequence.

data.title: Prevent committing `blob-store`
data.body:
`blob-store` is accidentally committed to my .atom repo recently: https://github.com/sparanoid/.atom/tree/master/blob-store

I think these files should be avoided.

data.title: ENOENT: no such file or directory...
data.body:
When I drag and drop a _file_ on to a _folder_ to overwrite an old file, I get the following error:

```
ENOENT: no such file or directory, rename '' -> /path/to/folder/
```

What should occur:

When I drop the new file onto the folder, if the file exists I should be prompted to ask if I want to overwrite the old one.

Atom 1.3.2 on Mint 17.2

data.title: Python autocomplete not working
data.body: Hi, so I am using atom to code in Python however the autocomplete isn't working only in Python. It works with others such as html and javascript. I have python-jedi and the autocomplete python packages enabled. Any help?

data.title: Atom freezes when opening a file
data.body:
I can open one file, named `index.coffee`in a certain folder. When I try to open another file, also named `index.coffee` in another folder, I will get this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/433707/11920016/75b8668a-a76b-11e5-88f8-a6967207361b.png)

Atom will not recover from this, so "Close" is the only option.

I can also switch the order of the files that I open -- it's always the second open that crashes it although the opening ordering can be switched.

Dev tools screenshot with pause pressed:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/433707/11920032/392bbe96-a76c-11e5-88cb-e97c602f1517.png)

Using Atom 1.3.2 with Win 7 64bit.

data.title: Multiple Packages for One Repository
data.body:
I have plugin X which is used as an atom plugin for my programming language. For our private beta, we need a way to enable X-beta for beta users that matches the responses expected by the beta branch of my language.

Is there a best practice for maintaining multiple versions of plugins at the same time? Currently I can't publish two packages because they both point to the same repo.

data.title: RTL text selection
data.body:
When trying to select a RTL substring, the highlighted text seems to be current but if you just press delete button, It will delete another part of the text instead of highlighted.

also double clicking on the text will highlight another word/part of text. 

It behaves like the position of the mouse is horizontally invert on the RTL text.

Simulate it:
First Test:
این یک متن فارسی است
Select این With mouse down and mouse up and Press Delete button, and it will delete است instead of این:
این یک متن فارسی 

Second Test:
این یک متن فارسی است
Double click on رسی
رسی will be Highlighted but if you press delete, این will be deleted.

data.title: Windows - editor crashes when creating a file in remote directory
data.body:
Hi, I have a Mac OS directory remotely mapped in Windows 10, allowing me to develop on Windows while server is running on a mac. I achieve this by mapping my Mac home folder as a network folder in Windows, then opening it in Atom.

Everything works fine unless I try to create a file using Tree view in atom somewhere in the tree structure  of my project. Atom succeeds to create the file, however crashes right afterwards.

I am attaching the dmp file in ZIP.

I´m using Atom beta, version 4.1.0-beta3, could be the culprit...

[0b34ecad-7847-4e04-a513-b1bfa47ec2fa.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/67775/0b34ecad-7847-4e04-a513-b1bfa47ec2fa.zip)

data.title: Atom is broken, when opening it shows a screen like Chrome would when you use Inspect element
data.body:
This is the screen when I open atom: http://vgy.me/liQWlM.png I get the same screen even after I reinstall it. I haven't changed anything since it last worked on my computer so I'm really confused as to why it's doing this. Any help would be great as Atom is my go to code editor right now.

EDIT: Clearing my c/users/alex/.atom directory fixed the issue, it may have been Activate Power Mode package's newest update.

data.title: Login Atom, Sync data in cloud
data.body: Login atom and sync all atom config + packages information to cloud, that would be great

data.title: Print steps time during Grunt tasks and script/bootstrap
data.body:
After talking to @maxbrunsfeld about how we may speed up our CI times, we agreed it could have been beneficial to have a better understanding about where the build time gets spent.

As a result, this PR introduces two more pieces of information when building Atom:
1. Package/Modules (un)install times.
2. Grunt tasks times. (these include running specs, linting, transpiling, etc.)

![screen shot 2015-12-19 at 17 52 22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/11914198/9ae037c8-a679-11e5-936d-88c6f74fc7cb.png)

![screen shot 2015-12-19 at 17 52 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/11914195/72febdc4-a679-11e5-91ec-f5d93bb741b7.png)

(You can see a more detailed report at https://travis-ci.org/atom/atom/jobs/97848561)

/cc: @maxbrunsfeld @nathansobo @atom/core

data.title: Release notes are stuck in atom since the release of the beta channel
data.body:
Hi,

I am wondering if it's just me or if nobody cares.

Since I've downloaded Atom beta additionally to Atom stable, the release notes in Atom (stable and beta) are stuck at v1.1.0.

Upgrading to newer version still works, but when I click to squirrel icon in the bottom right corner, I always see the same old release notes.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/623932/11912635/ed29d6ca-a646-11e5-8eb4-edef13fd8ed4.png)
On the picture, you'll see the release notes in the browser, the releases in Atom stable and the release notes in Atom beta.
